result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke R Davis

defendant.name: Davis, Luke R
defendant.address: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Luke R Davis
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 11-04-2022)
Prior: 12860 President Ave, Brookfield, WI 53005

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

1:17 PM Defendant Luke R Davis in court, in custody. Attorney Mark Kershek appears as friend of the court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Atty. Kershek states the defendant will likely retain attorney Nicole Muller.  Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant allowed a phone call to obtain bail.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
